title: Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Alabama top CFP ranking

content: Draft norms also make airlines liable for refunds via travel agents; stakeholder feedback invited till November 30

title: Op Chhatru: Security forces launch anti-terror operation in J&K's Kishtwar
content: Security forces have initiated an anti-terror operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar following specific intelligence. Alert troops of the Army's White Knight Corps engaged terrorists in the Chhatru area, leading to an exchange of fire. The operation is currently ongoing.

title: Trump reacts to Zohran Mamdani winning NYC mayor race; defends Republican loss
content: Donald Trump attributed Republican losses in the New York City mayoral race to his absence from the ballot and government shutdowns. Zohran Mamdani, a Democratic socialist, became the city's youngest and first Muslim mayor, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa amidst record voter turnout. Trump had previously warned against Mamdani's victory, calling him a "Communist lunatic."

title: Kabaddi player Gurvinder Singh shot dead in Punjab; Bishnoi gang claims responsibility
content: Kabaddi player Gurvinder Singh was allegedly shot and killed in Ludhiana, Punjab, with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang claiming responsibility. This follows another fatal attack on a Kabaddi player, Tejpal, on October 31, 2025, raising concerns about escalating gang violence. Police are investigating the social media claims and heightened security is in place.

title: Exclusive - '2017 World Cup was like a green revolution': Ex-womenâ€™s team head coach
content: After guiding India to their maiden Womenâ€™s ODI World Cup triumph, debate has erupted over Harmanpreet Kaurâ€™s future as captain. While former skipper Shantha Rangaswamy feels the 36-year-old should â€œfinish on a highâ€ and hand over the reins to Smriti Mandhana, ex-coach Tushar Arothe believes Harmanpreet still has plenty left to lead India to more ICC titles.

title: Amazon sends cease-and-desist letter to Perplexity, says: Stop your Bots, we don't want to be part of Comet browser
content: Amazon has issued a cease-and-desist to Perplexity AI over its Comet browser agent making purchases. Amazon alleges fraud and terms violations, claiming Comet degrades the shopping experience and creates privacy risks. Perplexity counters, accusing Amazon of anti-competitive behavior and protecting its ad revenue, marking a significant clash over autonomous AI agents.

title: IND vs AUS: Ex-Pak coach calls India all-rounder a subcontinent bully
content: Former Australian pacer Jason Gillespie has lauded Washington Sundar's unbeaten 49, suggesting he should bat higher than Axar Patel. Gillespie, impressed by Sundar's fearless approach against Australian pacers, highlighted the all-rounder's great attitude and confidence. Sundar's knock was crucial in India's five-wicket win, tying the series 1-1.

title: Stock market holiday: Will NSE & BSE remain open or closed for Guru Nanak Jayanti?
content: Indian stock markets, including the NSE and BSE, will be closed on Wednesday, November 5, in observance of Guru Nanak Jayanti. Trading will resume on Thursday, November 6, following the regular Monday-to-Friday schedule. This holiday marks the 556th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev Ji, the founder of Sikhism.

title: NYC mayoral election: Trump's foe Mamdani wins high-stake battle
content: Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old state assembly member, has been elected New York City's youngest and first Muslim mayor, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa. The election saw record turnout, with Mamdani, once a protest candidate, triumphing in a contest heavily influenced by Donald Trump's vocal opposition and threats to cut federal funding.

title: Post-Meta poaching drama: Months after Zuckerberg hires ScaleAI talent; CFO says â€˜not a zombie companyâ€™
content: Scale AI's CFO has refuted claims of the company being a "zombie" following Meta's significant investment. Despite initial speculation and some layoffs, Scale AI reports strong recent deal signings and revenue growth. The company emphasizes its continued independence and operational strength, with plans for expansion and new hires.

title: Chhattisgarh: Train hit parked cargo rake after signal breach; toll rises to 11
content: A local train collided with a stationary cargo rake in Chhattisgarh, resulting in 11 passenger deaths and at least 20 injuries. Preliminary reports suggest a signal breach caused the devastating crash. Rescue and relief efforts are underway, with authorities investigating the incident and providing compensation to victims.

title: Zohran Mamdani becomes New York Mayor: What is his religion?
content: Zohran Mamdani, a Shia Muslim raised in an interfaith family, has captured New York City's heart, symbolizing a break from the old guard. Despite facing Islamophobic attacks and criticism over his anti-Zionist stance, his honesty and empathy resonated with voters, making him a historic mayor. His faith, personal and political, is rooted in the people who elected him.

title: After $12.6 billion Amazon stake cut, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes one of her biggest donations
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University a remarkable $80 million, one of its largest donations ever, bolstering diversity and equity initiatives. This substantial, unrestricted contribution will aid student aid, infrastructure, and operations, arriving at a crucial time for the institution. Scott's ongoing philanthropic spree includes significant gifts to other DEI causes and a reduction in her Amazon holdings.

title: How to pronounce Zohran Mamdani's name? What does it mean?
content: For months, anchors, opponents, and even allies stumbled over it. Zor-han Mandami. Zohr-anne Madani. One Republican rival reportedly gave up halfway through a live debate and settled on â€œthe assemblyman.â€

title: Womenâ€™s World Cup - 'Not on the same level with 1983': Gavaskarâ€™s bold take on India win
content: Indian women's cricket achieved a historic World Cup victory, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. This triumph, a culmination of persistence after previous near misses, drew parallels to the 1983 men's win. Legendary Sunil Gavaskar highlighted the win's significance, emphasizing sporting intelligence and the role of Indian coaches, while noting the women's team's established track record before this breakthrough.

title: Charlise Springer breaks silence after Blue Jays' World Series heartbreak
content: The Toronto Blue Jays' World Series dream ended in heartbreak, but George Springer's wife, Charlise, offered a message of gratitude and pride. Her words highlighted the team's resilience and the lasting memories created, reminding fans that baseball's true value lies in connection and shared moments, not just wins. The team vows to 'run it back' next season.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobeâ€™s heartbreaking moment with daughter Gianna Bryant
content: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams â€œdisgustingâ€ Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
content: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: Laid off on OPT: The 90-day limit puts status at risk; can workers stay?
content: An F-1 student's layoff on post-completion OPT has sparked widespread concern about the 90-day unemployment limit. Exceeding this cap risks immigration status and future benefits. While changing jobs is allowed, timely reporting of employment changes and securing a new, field-related position are crucial to maintaining OPT status. Understanding these rules is vital for international graduates.

title: Babar Azam fails again! Pakistan starâ€™s shocking slump continues - stats reveal decline
content: Babar Azam's century drought has extended to 80 international innings, raising concerns about his current form despite his high ICC ranking. His recent struggles, including a 7-run knock against South Africa, have overshadowed Pakistan's close ODI victory. Pressure mounts for the captain to rediscover his batting touch in the remaining matches.

title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open on Guru Nanak Jayanti? Check state-wise list
content: Banks across numerous states will be closed on Wednesday, November 5th, for Guru Nanak Jayanti and Kartik Purnima.  Customers needing in-person services should verify local schedules. While branches are shut, digital banking and ATMs remain operational for essential transactions.  Plan ahead for any branch-specific needs.

title: New mom Rihanna makes her first appearance since welcoming her baby girl
content: Rihanna made a stunning return to the spotlight at the 2025 CFDA Fashion Awards, supporting partner A$AP Rocky. She showcased a chic black trench coat and white trousers, radiating a natural post-baby glow. The couple's coordinated style and undeniable chemistry fueled ongoing speculation about their marital status.

title: Guru Nanak Jayanti 2025: Guruparb best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share
content: Guru Nanak Jayanti, or Gurpurab, celebrates the birth of the first Sikh Guru, Guru Nanak Dev Ji. The occasion emphasizes his teachings of love, equality, and selfless service, reminding followers to live by his words. Celebrations include prayers, kirtans, and community feasts, with the year 2025 marking another opportunity to honor his divine spirit.

title: 'Zohran for New York City': Mamdani's first reaction on becoming new mayor; shares video
content: Zohran Mamdani has made history as New York City's first Muslim mayor, securing a landmark victory. The Ugandan-born, Indian-origin Democrat's triumph over prominent rivals in a record election saw over two million votes cast. His initial public reaction, a symbolic video announcing his arrival at City Hall, marked his momentous win.

title: Virat Kohli turns 37: A journey through the records, milestones, and legacy of the King
content: Virat Kohli, a phenomenon beyond cricket, turns 37, celebrated for his unparalleled consistency and dedication. His career is marked by numerous defining records, including most ODI centuries and fastest to 10,000 ODI runs. Even after a rare setback, Kohli demonstrated his enduring greatness with a match-winning performance.

title: Virginia elections: Democrat Abigail Spanberger wins race
content: Virginia has elected Abigail Spanberger as its first female governor, unseating Republicans. The race, seen as a national referendum, saw Spanberger focus on economic issues.  Meanwhile, Ghazala Hashmi made history as the first Indian American and Muslim to win statewide office, becoming Lieutenant Governor.

title: US cargo plane crashes near Louisville airport: 3 dead, 11 injured
content: A UPS cargo plane crashed shortly after takeoff from Louisville, Kentucky, erupting in flames and sending thick black smoke over the area. The McDonnell Douglas MD-11 aircraft was bound for Hawaii. Authorities confirmed at least three fatalities and multiple significant injuries, with the investigation into the cause underway.

title: Why is Celina Jaitlyâ€™s brother Major Vikrant detained in UAE? All you need to know about the case
content: Actor Celina Jaitly's brother, retired Major Vikrant Jaitley, has been detained in the UAE for over 14 months without clear charges. Jaitley has approached the Delhi High Court seeking legal and medical assistance for her brother, and direct communication. The court has directed the Ministry of External Affairs to facilitate contact and appoint a nodal officer.

title: Kayla Nicole faces backlash for posts hinting at Travis Kelce feelings
content: Travis Kelce's ex, Kayla Nicole, sparked online frenzy by wearing a tie-dye hoodie fans believe belongs to the NFL star.  The viral clip, showing her in the same garment Kelce sported years ago, ignited speculation about obsession and revenge dressing, especially with Kelce now dating Taylor Swift.  The internet debated whether it was a deliberate statement or mere coincidence.

title: 'Shaadi kab hai?': Shah Rukh Khan questions Rinku Singh
content: Bollywood icon Shah Rukh Khan celebrated his 60th birthday with warm wishes from the cricket fraternity, including KKR star Rinku Singh. Khan playfully asked Singh about his upcoming wedding, adding to the anticipation for the cricketer's marriage to Priya Saroj next year. Their relationship began in 2022 after Singh was drawn to a photo of Saroj.

title: The Siliguri storm: Richa Ghosh battled a finger fracture to fire India to World Cup win
content: Despite a shocking World Cup final loss, Richa Ghosh emerged as a fearless game-changer, battling a fractured finger to deliver crucial performances. Her aggressive batting, highest strike rate, and 12 sixes in the tournament, coupled with improved fitness and shot selection, highlight her immense willpower and dedication to achieving her World Cup dreams.

title: 'Mass chaos': US govt warns shutdown could force airspace closure - what it means
content: US transport secretary Sean Duffy has warned of "mass chaos" in air travel if the government shutdown persists. He highlighted worsening staff shortages among air traffic controllers and TSA personnel, predicting long queues, flight delays, and potential airspace closures.  This shutdown, on track to be the longest, is impacting public services as political deadlock continues.

title: UN says global emissions at new peak; India logs steepest rise
content: Global greenhouse gas emissions surged 2.3% in 2024, reaching a record 57.7 gigatons, with India and China leading the absolute increase. Projections indicate a 2.3-2.5Â°C rise in global temperatures by century's end, significantly missing Paris Agreement goals. Despite some progress, current climate actions are insufficient to avert severe climate risks.

title: Encounter Breaks Out In J&K's Kishtwar Between Security Forces, Terrorists
content: An encounter broke out between security forces and terrorists in the general area of Chhatru in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district in the early hours of Wednesday, officials said.

title: A Teaser In Zohran Mamdani's First Post After Winning New York Mayor Polls
content: Zohran Mamdani has shared video of City Hall station in his first social media post after winning the New York mayoral polls.

title: "Trump Wasn't On Ballot": US President As Democrats Sweep Major Key Polls
content: President Donald Trump has an explanation as to why Republicans lost US elections. First, he was not on the ballot and second, the longest shutdown in the US history, President noted.

title: Over 20,000 Vehicles Fined In Delhi As Cops Intensify Anti-Pollution Action
content: More than 20,000 challans have been issued in Delhi under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP)-2 since its implementation on October 19, 2025, as part of measures to curb vehicular pollution.

title: Zohran Mamdani Wins New York Poll, Becomes 1st Indian-American Muslim Mayor
content: In a big win for Democrats, Zohran Mamdani has been elected mayor of New York City, capping a stunning ascent for the 34-year-old state lawmaker, who was set to become the city's most liberal mayor in generations.

title: Majority Of Americans Say Trump Tariffs Making Life More Expensive: Survey
content: A large share of Americans said US President Donald Trump's tariffs are making life more expensive and hitting their family budgets, according to a new ABC News/Washington Post/Ipsos survey.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi Death Count Rises To 66 In Philippines
content: The death toll from Typhoon Kalmaegi in the Philippines climbed to 66 on Wednesday as residents of hardest-hit Cebu province began picking through homes and businesses devastated by the worst flooding in recent memory.

title: Getty Images Suffers Major Defeat In Lawsuit Against British AI Firm
content: US media company Getty Images largely lost a case it brought against a British AI firm over use of its copyrighted content without permission, a court in London said on Tuesday.

title: US Elections LIVE Updates: Zohran Mamdani Wins New York Mayor Polls
content: US Mayoral Election 2025 LIVE: In the United States, New York City, New Jersey, Virginia, and California are voting in the first major Election Day since President Donald Trump returned to the White House.

title: Trump's Strength, Democrats' Message, Economy. Takeaways From Election 2025
content: Trump was largely absent from the campaign trail, but the Republican candidates closely aligned themselves with the president, betting that his big win last year could provide a path to victory this time.

title: Democrat Mary Sheffield Elected Detroit's First Woman Mayor
content: City Council President Mary Sheffield will be Detroit's newest mayor and the first woman to lead the city. She defeated popular megachurch pastor the Rev. Solomon Kinloch in Tuesday's general election.

title: Girl Kidnapped, Gang-Raped While Returning From School In Assam
content: A minor girl was allegedly raped by three individuals in Assam's Tinsukia district, an incident that has sparked local outrage and a demand for immediate arrests.

title: Zohran Mamdani: Democrat With India Link To Be New York's 1st Muslim Mayor
content: Self-described Democratic Socialist Zohran Mamdani is set to become New York City's first Muslim mayor. The 34-year-old has defeated independent candidate Andrew Cuomo and Republican Curtis Sliwa in the mayoral polls.

title: Projects Worth Rs 2 Lakh Crore Underway In Uttarakhand: Pushkar Singh Dhami
content: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Tuesday said development projects worth over Rs 2 lakh crore are underway in the state with the support of the central government.

title: History-Sheeter Involved In Over 100 Robbery Cases Arrested In Pune
content: The Navi Mumbai police have arrested a 47-year-old history sheeter involved in over 100 cases of theft from Pune, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Man Gets 3 Months Jail For Sexually Harassing Minor In Mumbai Local Train
content: A special court has sentenced a 27-year-old man to three months of imprisonment for sexually harassing a minor on board a local train, noting that traveling in the general compartment does not justify any male passenger repeatedly touching a woman.

title: UP To Pay Rs 75,000 Man Over Kidnapping Case Despite Woman's Denial
content: Allahabad High Court has imposed a cost of Rs 75,000 on the Uttar Pradesh government for continuing the probe into a kidnapping case despite the alleged victim's statement before a magistrate that she had gone to Delhi of her own free will.

title: Police Suspect Robbery Linked To Murder Of Delhi Jal Board Employee
content: A Delhi Jal Board employee who was found dead inside a flat in Delhi's Begumpur was likely killed during a robbery, police said on Tuesday.

title: Indian-American Democrat Ghazala Hashmi Is Virginia's New Lieutenant Governor
content: Ghazala Hashmi was four when she emigrated with her mother and older brother from India to the United States where they joined her father in Georgia.

title: World Must Learn From Op Sindoor, Ongoing Wars Guided By Ego: Air Force Chief
content: Indian Air Force chief Amarpreet Singh has praised the timely cessation of the conflict with Pakistan in May, asserting that the world must learn how to terminate a conflict from Operation Sindoor.

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Top-10 upset, Latson's Gamecocks debut, Iowa breakout
content: a top-10 upset helped tip off the opening day of the 2025-26 women's college basketball season . no. 7 Duke fell 58-52 to no. 16 Baylor in the opener of the Oui-Play doubleheader in Paris . defending national champion UConn opens its season Tuesday vs. Louisville .

title: 7 big questions that will impact the 2026 NCAA tournament bracket
content: the first in-season projections of the 2026 March Madness field of 68 will release Nov. 11 . the reasons are that the Big Ten and the SEC have more contenders to chase the respective league favorites . Bracketology is a prisoner of probability and it's simply more likely that Houston and Duke ride the wave of their respective conferences to a No. 1 seed .

title: Pesticide fumes kill boy & sister in MP, parents critical
content: a cooler kept near the grain may have diverted the fume from celphos tablets . two children, aged 4 and 13, were found unconscious on the ground floor of the family home . the children were rushed to hospital where they were declared dead on arrival .

title: Muslim man must notify 1st wife to register 2nd marriage: Kerala HC
content: a Muslim man cannot register his second marriage without notifying his first wife as long as his marital relationship with her is valid . the petitioners argued that under Muslim personal law, a man is entitled to have up to four wives at a time . he held that the registrar shall not register a second marriage if the first wife objected .

title: Iltija launches massive campaign in Budgam as CM Omar holds â€˜darbarâ€™ in Jammu
content: mehbooba mufti-led Peoplesâ€™ Democratic Party (PDP) has placed Iltija and Waheed Parra at the forefront of its campaign . their focus remains on cornering J&K chief minister Omar Abdullah . in the bypoll, NCâ€™s Aga Syed Mehmood is pitted against PDPâ€™s .

title: Maharashtra to hold local body polls on December 2
content: two subsequent phases will cover 32 zilla parishads and 336 panchayat samitis and 29 municipal corporations, including BMC . the statewide election will be the first major after the assembly polls last year . it comes amid rising protests by the Opposition alleging there were many irregulacies .

title: Enumeration for Phase-II of SIR in 12 states/UTs gets under way
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the â€˜primeâ€™ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. title: Number of road fatalities in 2024 likely to surpass 2023 figure, the highest ever
content: in 2023, road crashes claimed 1.73 lakh lives, the highest ever for a year . a little over 1.7 lakh people died in road crashes last year, according to provisional data compiled from states/UTs, excluding west Bengal .

title: 'Aero models, drones not same'; government urged to review draft bill
content: the draft civil drone (promotion and regulation) bill, 2025, could make it nearly impossible for enthusiasts, schools, and clubs to continue the century-old tradition of aeromodelling in India . the bill clubbed aeromodeling without appreciating the vast difference between the two .

title: Bihar polls: 10% of population controls Army, says Rahul; stirs row
content: "10% of the country's population" controls the Army, opposition leader says . "the remaining 90% - backward classes, Dalits, STs, and minorities - are nowhere to be seen," he said . the comments echoe calls for a national caste census .

title: Gayle didnâ€™t flee: Rasool slams memes mocking star after Kashmir cricket fiasco
content: former all-rounder parvez Rasool condemns social media memes mocking west indies star Chris Gayle . gayle was seen enjoying a ride on Dal Lake last week, smiling and waving to fans . he said gayle praised one of our boys and said he played well .

title: Direct cash transfers: Sops for women now a norm; 12 states' outgo to be Rs 1.7 lakh crore
content: this year, the states are projected to spend 0.5% of GDP on unconditional cash transfers to women, a study by PRS Legislative Research has said . just two years ago, the figure was less than 0.2% of GDP . the beneficiaries are clearly happy, although the state exchequer feels the strain of such bounties .

title: Parties go all out as campaign for Bihar polls 1st phase ends
content: more than 3.75 crore electors are expected to cast their votes at 45,341 polling stations to decide the fate of 1,314 candidates . governing NDA and INDIA bloc-led opposition left no stone unturned to reach out to voters .

title: 'Typo' lands man in jail under NSA, HC fines collector
content: a young man named in a private dispute was charged under the national security act . he was jailed for over a year for "typing error" he admitted to "mixing up" names while checking and signing separate orders . the amount will go to the newly married man who languished in jail for no fault of his .
